page.title: 15INTERVIEW-continued
page.content: part of their social life,a visit to the cinema was an infrequent event. They had found holiday jobs while still at school easy to get provided transport could be found and you were willing to do anything;casual labour on farms or local pubs. All 3 appreciated their 'luck' in finding jobs after leaving school and none had anytime for the Y.T.S.scheme. They felt these were a form of cheap labour and excuses for jobs,providing no real training or proper insight into the world of work. Wider world issues concerned them little.They showed a minimal interest in political,social or economic problems of other countries or peoples.They freely admitted to this apathetic attitude and thought too much consideration of other peoples problems was depressing.
